intro: Microula muliensis, commonly known as the Yunnan microula, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan Province. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in high-altitude regions, showcasing adaptations to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and usually white or pale pink, with a subtle fragrance, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
